identificationModule.officialTitle: Improving COVID-19 Vaccine Uptake Among Racial and Ethnic Minority Groups With Rheumatic Diseases

collaborators.name: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)
National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases (NIAMS)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The overall goal of this study is to determine whether a novel, multi-modal, patient-directed behavioral intervention initiated in rheumatology clinics is an effective approach to improve uptake of updated COVID-19 vaccine.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Black and Latinx persons are at higher risk for certain autoimmune and inflammatory rheumatic diseases (AIRD) and have experienced worse COVID-19 outcomes compared to their white counterparts. Given the risks of severe COVID-19 outcomes such as hospitalization and death in people with AIRD, COVID-19 vaccine is recommended in this population. Historically, overall vaccine uptake among people with AIRDs has been low, and this vaccine reluctance has extended to COVID-19 vaccination. While additional COVID-19 vaccine doses have offered considerable added protection against severe outcomes, only 20% of all vaccinated persons in Alabama (AL) and 45% in Massachusetts have obtained an additional dose of COVID-19 vaccine as of October 2022. Racial and ethnic minority groups have faced disparities in obtaining subsequent COVID-19 vaccines, particularly in under-resourced communities, including those in Alabama and Massachusetts. Together, these obstacles exacerbate existing health inequities among people of color and perpetuate worse COVID-19 outcomes.

We will conduct a randomized controlled study to test an intervention that seeks to address gaps in COVID-19 vaccine information and access inequities common in Black and Latinx populations.

armGroups.label: "Storytelling" video including patient narratives, brochure and patient navigation
armGroups.description: Participants will review video with narratives on COVID-19 vaccination in patients with AIRD, receive brochure on the same topic; and interact with patient navigators.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Video comprised of AIRD patient narratives on COVID-19 vaccination thoughts and experiences
Behavioral: Brochure on COVID-19 vaccination in AIRD patients

armGroups.label: Attention Control: "Oral Health" video and "Oral Health" brochure
armGroups.description: Participants will review video on the importance of oral health in patients with AIRD and receive brochure on the same topic.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Video on the importance of good oral health for patients with AIRD
Behavioral: Brochure on the importance of good oral health in AIRD patients

interventions.name: Video comprised of AIRD patient narratives on COVID-19 vaccination thoughts and experiences
interventions.description: Participants will watch video focused on the importance of receipt of updated COVID-19 vaccination in patients with AIRD
armGroupLabels: "Storytelling" video including patient narratives, brochure and patient navigation

interventions.name: Video on the importance of good oral health for patients with AIRD
interventions.description: Participants will watch video on the importance of good oral health in AIRD patients.
armGroupLabels: Attention Control: "Oral Health" video and "Oral Health" brochure

interventions.name: Brochure on COVID-19 vaccination in AIRD patients
armGroupLabels: "Storytelling" video including patient narratives, brochure and patient navigation

interventions.name: Patient Navigation
interventions.description: Participants will receive phone calls from patient navigators to provide support and information for receipt of updated COVID-19 vaccination in patients with AIRD
armGroupLabels: "Storytelling" video including patient narratives, brochure and patient navigation

interventions.name: Brochure on the importance of good oral health in AIRD patients
interventions.description: Participants will receive a brochure on the importance of good oral health in AIRD patients.
armGroupLabels: Attention Control: "Oral Health" video and "Oral Health" brochure

primaryOutcomes.description: We will measure rates of receipt of updated COVID-19 vaccination.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults (18+ years) with known AIRD
* Black race and/or Latinx ethnicity
* Individuals who have not obtained the updated COVID-19 vaccine series (self-report)

Exclusion Criteria:

-Lack of access to phone
